alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 5:38AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Feliciana, central West Baton Rouge, St. Helena, Pointe Coupee, northwestern St. Tammany, northern Livingston, East Feliciana, Tangipahoa, East Baton Rouge and Washington Parishes through 645 AM CDT... At 538 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kentwood to 6 miles west of Zachary. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Zachary, Baker, Bogalusa, Denham Springs, New Roads, Franklinton, Jackson, St. Francisville, Clinton, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Walker, Amite City, Kentwood, Livingston, Independence and Varnado. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 13 and 50. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 27 and 65. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
